metadata.title: CVE-2021-35942 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
The wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 may crash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) when called with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in a denial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoi was used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-35942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.34-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.34-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.34-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.34-0ubuntu1').
